Fry chopped onions till soft. Add 400ml water. Separately fry cubed potato and sliced carrot with ginger and garlic, then add to the broth. Add Katsu curry mix and wait for it to thicken on a simmering heat. Separately sprinkle soy sauce onto cucumber and light fry quorn chicken. The curry mix was from the international food isle of the super market.
The quorn chicken was fried in a low fat fryer. It was that or cut up a breaded chicken burger.

WRITING.TEXT:
I have gamed on TVs for about 5 years now. I play all games on max difficultly and encounter no handicap or noticeable lag. anything tiny you probably compensate for unconsciously.
You seriously dont notice a difference and anyone who argues they are unplayable has never tried. I imagine if your a pro gamer you may have different opinions but pro gamers dont play in their living room. for everyone else it would be awesome.
I look at people with these mind blowingly awesome rigs and tiny screens and I dont understand it.

Not one for competitive games, more strategy and role playing.
I gave Battlefront ago which looked incredible but i was hopeless in comparison.
i7 4770k overclock, 970 gtx, 16gb ram, Corsair 330r silent case
I always wanted an Ibanez and confess I bought it for its looks. It is beautiful and plays like a dream.
Yeah, chair from ikea, got a foot rest too for long gaming sessions
Your not wrong, and seemingly the only object in the room that does. Not a spec of dust in my rig
